<div className="avatar">
  <div className="avatar__photo-link avatar__photo avatar__photo--lg">
    <img
      src="data:image/png;base64,"
      alt="Change Data Format"
    />
  </div>
  <div className="avatar__intro">
    <h4 className="avatar__name">Change data from one format to another</h4>
    <small className="avatar__subtitle">
      Component key: <b>change-data-format</b>
    </small>
  </div>
</div>

## Description

The **change data format** component allows you to convert data between common formats, like JSON, XML, CSV, and YAML, and to serialize (turn an object into a string) or deserialize (turn a string into an object) each supported format.

For example, the "JSON to XML" action will convert a JSON string that looks like this:

```json
{
  "user": {
    "name": "John Doe",
    "dob": "19880101",
    "phones": ["555-123-4567", "555-555-5555"]
  }
}
```

into an XML string that looks like this:

```xml
<user>
  <name>John Doe</name>
  <dob>19880101</dob>
  <phones>555-123-4567</phones>
  <phones>555-555-5555</phones>
</user>
```

A "Deserialize XML" action, when run on the above XML, would convert the XML into an object whose keys can be referenced in subsequent steps.

<Screenshot filename="components/deserialize-xml.png" />

## Actions

<div id="converttoboolean" />

### Convert To Boolean

Convert a value to a boolean | <small><b>key: convertToBoolean</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      required: true,
      key: "value",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "The value to be converted to a boolean",
    },
  ]}
/>

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />

<div id="csvtojson" />

### CSV to JSON

Convert CSV to JSON | <small><b>key: csvToJson</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to change format of",
      language: "csv",
      required: true,
      comments: "CSV data to convert to JSON",
      example:
        '"person__first","person__last","dob"\n"Bob","Johnson","1990-01-01"',
      key: "data",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      comments: "Specify if your CSV contains a header row.",
      key: "isHeader",
      type: "boolean",
      default: "true",
      label: "CSV Header",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      comments:
        "When enabled, keys with double-underscores will be parsed as nested objects. For example, 'person__first,person__last' will become '{ person: { first, last } }' rather than '{ person__first, person__last }'",
      key: "unFlattenCsvKeys",
      type: "boolean",
      default: "false",
      label: "Un-Flatten CSV Keys",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": "{\n  \"person\": {\n    \"first\": \"Bob\",\n    \"last\": \"Johnson\"\n  },\n  \"dob\": \"1990-01-01\"\n}",
  "contentType": "application/json"
}
```

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />

<div id="csvtoxml" />

### CSV to XML

Convert CSV to XML | <small><b>key: csvToXml</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to change format of",
      language: "csv",
      required: true,
      comments: "CSV data to convert to XML",
      example:
        '"person__first","person__last","dob"\n"Bob","Johnson","1990-01-01"',
      key: "data",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      comments: "Specify if your CSV contains a header row.",
      key: "isHeader",
      type: "boolean",
      default: "true",
      label: "CSV Header",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      comments:
        "When enabled, keys with double-underscores will be parsed as nested objects. For example, 'person__first,person__last' will become '{ person: { first, last } }' rather than '{ person__first, person__last }'",
      key: "unFlattenCsvKeys",
      type: "boolean",
      default: "false",
      label: "Un-Flatten CSV Keys",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": "<dob>1990-01-01</dob>\n<person>\n  <first>Bob</first>\n  <last>Johnson</last>\n</person>",
  "contentType": "text/xml"
}
```

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />

<div id="csvtoyaml" />

### CSV to YAML

Convert CSV to YAML | <small><b>key: csvToYaml</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to change format of",
      language: "csv",
      required: true,
      comments: "CSV data to convert to YAML",
      example:
        '"person__first","person__last","dob"\n"Bob","Johnson","1990-01-01"',
      key: "data",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      comments: "Specify if your CSV contains a header row.",
      key: "isHeader",
      type: "boolean",
      default: "true",
      label: "CSV Header",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      comments:
        "When enabled, keys with double-underscores will be parsed as nested objects. For example, 'person__first,person__last' will become '{ person: { first, last } }' rather than '{ person__first, person__last }'",
      key: "unFlattenCsvKeys",
      type: "boolean",
      default: "false",
      label: "Un-Flatten CSV Keys",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": "---\nperson:\n  first: Bob\n  last: Johnson\ndob: '1990-01-01'",
  "contentType": "text/yaml"
}
```

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to deserialize",
      language: null,
      required: true,
      comments:
        "BINARY text to deserialize so it can be referenced in a subsequent step.",
      example: null,
      key: "data",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": {
    "person": {
      "first": "Bob",
      "last": "Johnson"
    },
    "dob": "1990-01-01"
  }
}
```

### Deserialize CSV

Deserialize CSV data | <small><b>key: deserializeFromCsv</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to deserialize",
      language: "csv",
      required: true,
      comments:
        "CSV text to deserialize so it can be referenced in a subsequent step.",
      example:
        '"person__first","person__last","dob"\n"Bob","Johnson","1990-01-01"',
      key: "data",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      comments: "Specify if your CSV contains a header row.",
      key: "isHeader",
      type: "boolean",
      default: "true",
      label: "CSV Header",
    },
    {
      required: true,
      comments:
        "When enabled, keys with double-underscores will be parsed as nested objects. For example, 'person__first,person__last' will become '{ person: { first, last } }' rather than '{ person__first, person__last }'",
      key: "unFlattenCsvKeys",
      type: "boolean",
      default: "false",
      label: "Un-Flatten CSV Keys",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": {
    "person": {
      "first": "Bob",
      "last": "Johnson"
    },
    "dob": "1990-01-01"
  }
}
```

### Deserialize JSON

Deserialize JSON data | <small><b>key: deserializeFromJson</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to deserialize",
      language: "json",
      required: true,
      comments:
        "JSON text to deserialize so it can be referenced in a subsequent step.",
      example:
        '{\n  "person": {\n    "first": "Bob",\n    "last": "Johnson"\n  },\n  "dob": "1990-01-01"\n}',
      key: "data",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": {
    "person": {
      "first": "Bob",
      "last": "Johnson"
    },
    "dob": "1990-01-01"
  }
}
```

<div id="deserializejsonl" />

### Deserialize JSON Lines (.jsonl)

Transform .jsonl data to a JavaScript array | <small><b>key: deserializeJsonl</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      required: true,
      example:
        '["Name", "Session", "Score", "Completed"]\n["Gilbert", "2013", 24, true]\n["Alexa", "2013", 29, true]\n["May", "2012B", 14, false]\n["Deloise", "2012A", 19, true]',
      key: "jsonl",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "JSONL Data",
    },
  ]}
/>

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />

### Deserialize URL-encoded Form Data

Deserialize Form Data (x-www-form-urlencoded) | <small><b>key: deserializeFormData</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to deserialize",
      required: true,
      comments:
        "Form data to deserialize so it can be referenced in a subsequent step.",
      example: "foo=bar&baz=123",
      key: "data",
      type: "string",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
  ]}
/>

```
    "baz": "123"
  }
```

<div id="deserializefromxml" />

### Deserialize XML

Deserialize XML data | <small><b>key: deserializeFromXml</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to deserialize",
      language: "xml",
      required: true,
      comments:
        "XML text to deserialize so it can be referenced in a subsequent step.",
      example:
        "<dob>1990-01-01</dob>\n<person>\n  <first>Bob</first>\n  <last>Johnson</last>\n</person>",
      key: "data",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
    {
      required: false,
      comments: "Interpret numbers as strings?",
      key: "numbersAsStrings",
      type: "boolean",
      default: "false",
      label: "Parse numbers as strings?",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": {
    "person": {
      "first": "Bob",
      "last": "Johnson"
    },
    "dob": "1990-01-01"
  }
}
```

### JSON to CSV

Convert JSON to CSV | <small><b>key: jsonToCsv</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to change format of",
      language: "json",
      required: true,
      comments: "JSON data to convert to CSV",
      example:
        '{\n  "person": {\n    "first": "Bob",\n    "last": "Johnson"\n  },\n  "dob": "1990-01-01"\n}',
      key: "data",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": "\"person__first\",\"person__last\",\"dob\"\n\"Bob\",\"Johnson\",\"1990-01-01\"",
  "contentType": "text/csv"
}
```

### YAML to JSON

Convert YAML to JSON | <small><b>key: yamlToJson</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to change format of",
      language: "yaml",
      required: true,
      comments: "YAML data to convert to JSON",
      example: "---\nperson:\n  first: Bob\n  last: Johnson\ndob: '1990-01-01'",
      key: "data",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": "{\n  \"person\": {\n    \"first\": \"Bob\",\n    \"last\": \"Johnson\"\n  },\n  \"dob\": \"1990-01-01\"\n}",
  "contentType": "application/json"
}
```

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />

<div id="yamltoxml" />

### YAML to XML

Convert YAML to XML | <small><b>key: yamlToXml</b></small>

<ComponentInputsTable
  inputs={[
    {
      placeholder: "Data to change format of",
      language: "yaml",
      required: true,
      comments: "YAML data to convert to XML",
      example: "---\nperson:\n  first: Bob\n  last: Johnson\ndob: '1990-01-01'",
      key: "data",
      type: "code",
      default: "",
      label: "Data",
    },
  ]}
/>

#### Output Example Payload

```
{
  "data": "<dob>1990-01-01</dob>\n<person>\n  <first>Bob</first>\n  <last>Johnson</last>\n</person>",
  "contentType": "text/xml"
}
```

<hr className="componentActionSeparator" />
